query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 ‘Per me si va ne la città dolente, 2 per me si va ne l’etterno dolore, 3 per me si va tra la perduta gente.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Through me one goes to the city of woe, 2 through me one goes to eternal sorrow, 3 through me one goes among the lost people.
**Cornish:**
1 Dremmyn vyth y’n cita dhloowans, 2 dremmyn vyth y’n boes vewnans, 3 dremmyn vyth ynter an bobel gollet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Giustizia mosse il mio alto fattore; 5 fecemi la divina podestate, 6 la somma sapïenza e ’l primo amore.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Justice moved my exalted maker; 5 divine power made me, 6 supreme wisdom and primal love.
**Cornish:**
4 Gwirvos a waynyas va'gas ughel gwrier; 5 gwrians a wrug vy, 6 an ughella goweth hag an kynsa karanteth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Dinanzi a me non fuor cose create 8 se non etterne, e io etterno duro. 9 Lasciate ogne speranza, voi ch’intrate’.
query.result:
**English:**
7 Before me there were no created things, 8 only eternal things, and I endure eternally. 9 Abandon all hope, you who enter.
**Cornish:**
7 Kyns vy, na veu traowow kreyys, 8 mes traowow travoyl, ha my a vydh travoyl. 9 Gwellugh pub spyrans, why a dheuth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Queste parole di colore oscuro 11 vid’ ïo scritte al sommo d’una porta; 12 per ch’io: «Maestro, il senso lor m’è duro».
query.result:
**English:**
10 These words of dark color 11 I saw written at the top of a gate; 12 because of which I said: "Master, their meaning is hard for me".
**Cornish:**
10 An gerow ma'th liw tewel 11 a welas vy skrifys war ben porta; 12 rag hwra vy: "Mester, aga styr yw kalet dhym".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Ed elli a me, come persona accorta: 14 «Qui si convien lasciare ogne sospetto; 15 ogne viltà convien che qui sia morta.
query.result:
**English:**
13 And he to me, like a person who is wise: 14 "Here it is necessary to abandon every suspicion; 15 every cowardice must be dead here.
**Cornish:**
13 Ha henna dhym, kepar den furvysek: 14 "Ama res yw gwelles pub traha dowt; 15 pub kowarjeth res yw marow ama".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Noi siam venuti al loco ov’ i’ t’ho detto 17 che tu vedrai le genti dolorose 18 c’hanno perduto il ben de l’intelletto».
query.result:
**English:**
16 We have come to the place where I told you 17 that you will see the sorrowful people 18 who have lost the good of the intellect.
**Cornish:**
16 Nyns yw dyworth dhe'n le powyssy vy 17 le mayth gweles an dussergh trist 18 a gollas aga spyrys da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 E poi che la sua mano a la mia puose 20 con lieto volto, ond’ io mi confortai, 21 mi mise dentro a le segrete cose.
query.result:
**English:**
19 And after he placed his hand in mine 20 with a joyful face, which comforted me, 21 he led me inside to the secret things.
**Cornish:**
19 Ha wosa y gila dhe'm dowr, 20 gans chif cher, ow tressa vy, 21 y gorra dhe'n tressa kelmys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Quivi sospiri, pianti e alti guai 23 risonavan per l’aere sanza stelle, 24 per ch’io al cominciar ne lagrimai.
query.result:
**English:**
22 There sighs, cries, and loud lamentations 23 resounded through the starless air, 24 so that at the beginning I wept.
**Cornish:**
22 Ama olow, kellys ha galarow uhel 23 a sowne dre'n ebron heb steren, 24 rag hwra vy dhe'n dalleth dalleth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Diverse lingue, orribili favelle, 26 parole di dolore, accenti d’ira, 27 voci alte e fioche, e suon di man con elle
28 facevano un tumulto, il qual s’aggira 29 sempre in quell’ aura sanza tempo tinta, 30 come la rena quando turbo spira.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Diverse tongues, horrible languages, 26 words of pain, accents of anger, 27 loud and hoarse voices, and sounds of hands with them
28 made a tumult, which whirls around 29 always in that air, stained without time, 30 like the sand when a whirlwind blows.
**Cornish:**
25 Lies diverow, lavarow orth, 26 gerow dolur, accentyow godhvos, 27 lavow ughel ha whegh, ha sonow dorn gansow
28 a wra tus an gwrians, hag a wra’n troha 29 bys vythkweth na wra leunys, 30 kepar an gors pan wrello an gwyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 E io ch’avea d’error la testa cinta, 32 dissi: «Maestro, che è quel ch’i’ odo? 33 e che gent’ è che par nel duol sì vinta?».
query.result:
**English:**
31 And I, whose head was encircled with error, 32 said: "Master, what is that which I hear? 33 And what people are these who seem so overcome with grief?".
**Cornish:**
31 Ha my, a via an benen gans kamm, 32 a leveris: "Mester, pyth yw henna a glewaf? 33 Ha pyth pobel yw henna a wra gweles mar dhyghes?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ed elli a me: «Questo misero modo 35 tegnon l’anime triste di coloro 36 che visser sanza ’nfamia e sanza lodo.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And he to me: "This wretched mode 35 holds the sad souls of those 36 who lived without infamy or praise.
**Cornish:**
34 Ha henna dhymm: "An fordh magh us, 35 a with anow an enevalow trist 36 a vewas heb ankow ha heb mol."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Mischiate sono a quel cattivo coro 38 de li angeli che non furon ribelli 39 né fur fedeli a Dio, ma per sé fuoro.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Mingled are with that evil choir 38 of the angels who were not rebels 39 nor were faithful to God, but were for themselves.
**Cornish:**
37 Meskys yw genen gans an koweth magh 38 a'n elew nyns oas ribelyon 39 na feyth dhe Dew, mes a-dro dhe onan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Caccianli i ciel per non esser men belli, 41 né lo profondo inferno li riceve, 42 ch’alcuna gloria i rei avrebber d’elli».
query.result:
**English:**
40 Heaven casts them out so as not to be less beautiful, 41 and the deep hell does not receive them, 42 for the kings of hell would have some glory from them.
**Cornish:**
40 A skyll an nef dhe gorra'gas moy byw gwell, 41 ha'n uffern dowr nyns a wra vyttya, 42 rag reyth an uffern a wra nebes dhywortha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E io: «Maestro, che è tanto greve 44 a lor che lamentar li fa sì forte?». 45 Rispuose: «Dicerolti molto breve.
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I: "Master, what is so grievous 44 to them that makes them lament so loudly?". 45 He replied: "I will tell you very briefly.
**Cornish:**
43 Ha my a leveris: "Mestr, pyth yw kemmys 44 dhe'n gwella a wra aga whansowgh kemmys?". 45 Ev a leveris: "Yth wra leveris dhys vyr berr."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Questi non hanno speranza di morte, 47 e la lor cieca vita è tanto bassa, 48 che ’nvidïosi son d’ogne altra sorte.
query.result:
**English:**
46 These have no hope of death, 47 and their blind life is so base, 48 that they are envious of every other fate.
**Cornish:**
46 An re na wra govonnans a verwel, 47 ha'n byw aga bewnans dall heb isel, 48 wosa aga govyon a bub sort aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Fama di loro il mondo esser non lassa; 50 misericordia e giustizia li sdegna: 51 non ragioniam di lor, ma guarda e passa».
query.result:
**English:**
49 The world does not allow any fame of them; 50 mercy and justice disdain them: 51 let us not speak of them, but look and pass on."
**Cornish:**
49 Renk a-dro an bys na wra lesa byw; 50 trugarow ha gwirvos a wra aga kasia: 51 nyns a wra kovsowgh a-dro dhedha, mes gwel ha tremena."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Poscia ch’io v’ebbi alcun riconosciuto, 59 vidi e conobbi l’ombra di colui 60 che fece per viltade il gran rifiuto.
query.result:
**English:**
58 After I had recognized some of them, 59 I saw and recognized the shade of him 60 who made the great refusal through cowardice.
**Cornish:**
58 Wosa'm beu nebes aga adnevel, 59 a welas ha'm aswonnodh skewens an neb 60 a wrug an bras dyllo dre wostla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Incontanente intesi e certo fui 62 che questa era la setta d’i cattivi, 63 a Dio spiacenti e a’ nemici sui.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Immediately I understood and was certain 62 that this was the sect of the wicked, 63 displeasing to God and to His enemies.
**Cornish:**
61 Yn skon a welas ha'm aswonnodh sur, 62 wosa henna oas an sektys a'n drwg, 63 heb sodho dhe Dew ha dhe'y enebyon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Questi sciaurati, che mai non fur vivi, 65 erano ignudi e stimolati molto 66 da mosconi e da vespe ch’eran ivi.
query.result:
**English:**
64 These wretches, who never were alive, 65 were naked and much tormented 66 by gadflies and wasps that were there.
**Cornish:**
64 An dusyow ma, nag yw vew byth, 65 oas wonvos haval haval, 66 gans gwyls ha gwespes oas eno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Elle rigavan lor di sangue il volto, 68 che, mischiato di lagrime, a’ lor piedi 69 da fastidiosi vermi era ricolto.
query.result:
**English:**
67 She bathed their faces with blood, 68 which, mixed with tears, was gathered at their feet 69 by loathsome worms.
**Cornish:**
67 Ythollyas ythollyas aga'n enep gans gwydh, 68 hag, kemyskys gans degrow, dhe'n aga'n treys, 69 o prennow gwynn o'n jeves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E poi ch’a riguardar oltre mi diedi, 71 vidi genti a la riva d’un gran fiume; 72 per ch’io dissi: «Maestro, or mi concedi
73 ch’i’ sappia quali sono, e qual costume 74 le fa di trapassar parer sì pronte, 75 com’ i’ discerno per lo fioco lume».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And then when I gave myself to looking beyond, 71 I saw people on the bank of a great river; 72 because of which I said: "Master, now grant me
73 that I may know who they are, and what custom 74 makes them seem so ready to cross over, 75 as I discern by the faint light".
**Cornish:**
70 Ha pan vynnsav dhe weles dheuth, 71 mi a welas pobel war glan avon vrassa; 72 rag wov henna mi a leveris: "Mester, wrug genen
73 dhe wodhya pyns yw ens, ha pyns defesen 74 a wra ens dhe weles dhe dremena dhe drehedhes, 75 kepar ha'm gweles gans an golon gwanwyn?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Ed elli a me: «Le cose ti fier conte 77 quando noi fermerem li nostri passi 78 su la trista riviera d’Acheronte».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And he to me: "You will be told the things for sure 77 when we stop our steps 78 on the sad river of Acheron".
**Cornish:**
76 Ha henna dhym: "An pythow a vydh dyllys dhys
77 pan leverens agan passys 78 war avon trist Acheron".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Allor con li occhi vergognosi e bassi, 80 temendo no ’l mio dir li fosse grave, 81 infino al fiume del parlar mi trassi.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Then with my eyes ashamed and downcast, 80 fearing that my speech might be burdensome to him, 81 I drew myself to the river of speech.
**Cornish:**
79 An wosa henna gans owlagow treus ha isel, 80 ow tavas downa'm lavar a vijav troha, 81 bys dhe avon a lavar mi a dhasyas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Ed ecco verso noi venir per nave 83 un vecchio, bianco per antico pelo, 84 gridando: «Guai a voi, anime prave!
85 Non isperate mai veder lo cielo: 86 i’ vegno per menarvi a l’altra riva 87 ne le tenebre etterne, in caldo e ’n gelo.
query.result:
**English:**
82 And behold, towards us coming by boat 83 an old man, white with ancient hair, 84 crying out: "Woe to you, wicked souls!
85 Never hope to see heaven: 86 I come to take you to the other shore 87 into eternal darkness, into heat and into ice.
**Cornish:**
82 Ha weles, dheuth dhe'n-nestra tu, yn avon, 83 un hen, gwyn gans blew kottha, 84 ow klewes: "Gwiw dheuch, enevales drok!
85 Na spersouch bythkweth gwelhes an nef: 86 my a dheuth rag aga dheuch dhe'n nessa glann 87 yn tywyllow treweyth, yn tomm ha'n erch".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 E tu che se’ costì, anima viva, 89 pàrtiti da cotesti che son morti». 90 Ma poi che vide ch’io non mi partiva,
91 disse: «Per altra via, per altri porti 92 verrai a piaggia, non qui, per passare: 93 più lieve legno convien che ti porti».
query.result:
**English:**
88 And you who are there, living soul, 89 separate yourself from those who are dead". 90 But when he saw that I did not leave,
91 he said: "By another way, by other ports 92 you will come to shore, not here, to cross: 93 a lighter boat must carry you".
**Cornish:**
88 Ha tysen syw ena, eneval byw, 89 kewartha dhyworth an re ma yw marow". 90 Mes pan welas henna na vynnav kewartha,
91 leveris: "Gans nessa fordh, gans nessa porthow 92 ty a dheuth dhe glann, nag ena, rag tremena: 93 lesa lestr a wra rydh rag aga dhe dhasportha".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 E ’l duca lui: «Caron, non ti crucciare: 95 vuolsi così colà dove si puote 96 ciò che si vuole, e più non dimandare».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And the leader to him: "Charon, do not be angry: 95 it is so willed there where it is possible 96 to do whatever is wanted, and ask no more".
**Cornish:**
94 Ha'n dyghowr dhodho: "Karon, na wra dyghowsek: 95 hemma yw an wul ena le may hyllons 96 pythow yw wulsys, ha na vynna moy".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Quinci fuor quete le lanose gote 98 al nocchier de la livida palude, 99 che ’ntorno a li occhi avea di fiamme rote.
query.result:
**English:**
97 Thenceforth he pushed away those tearful cheeks 98 of the ferryman of the livid marsh, 99 who had eyes ringed with red flames.
**Cornish:**
97 Wosa henna ev a-dhorras an gweusow treus 98 dhe'n governour a'n mordir golow, 99 hag ow a-dro dhe'y dhelergh rudh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Ma quell’ anime, ch’eran lasse e nude, 101 cangiar colore e dibattero i denti, 102 ratto che ’nteser le parole crude.
query.result:
**English:**
100 But those souls, who were weary and naked, 101 changed color and gnashed their teeth, 102 as soon as they heard the harsh words.
**Cornish:**
100 Mes an eneow, o a-dhossa ha noeth, 101 a liwsa liw ha'gas aga dens, 102 pub sodho pub klewas an gerow krus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Bestemmiavano Dio e lor parenti, 104 l’umana spezie e ’l loco e ’l tempo e ’l seme 105 di lor semenza e di lor nascimenti.
query.result:
**English:**
103 They blasphemed God and their parents, 104 the human race, the place, the time, and the seed 105 of their seed and of their birth.
**Cornish:**
103 Yth blasfemyon Dew ha’ga hendas, 104 an keverel an dus, an prys ha’ga’n amser ha’ga’n had, 105 ha’ga’n hadow ha’ga’n genedhel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Poi si ritrasser tutte quante insieme, 107 forte piangendo, a la riva malvagia 108 ch’attende ciascun uom che Dio non teme.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Then they all gathered together, 107 weeping loudly, on the evil shore 108 that awaits every man who does not fear God.
**Cornish:**
106 Wosa henna yth omdhiskwedhes oll ow, 107 ow kanna yn kella, dhe’n glann drog, 108 a wra dhegemeres pub den na dheryv Dew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Caron dimonio, con occhi di bragia 110 loro accennando, tutte le raccoglie; 111 batte col remo qualunque s’adagia.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Charon the demon, with eyes of burning coal, 110 beckoning to them, gathers them all together; 111 he beats with his oar anyone who lingers.**Cornish:**
109 Caron an dhyw, ganshednow tan tanow, 110 ow tos ow, ow a's kever, 111 ow a's keffras neb an neb a set.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Come d’autunno si levan le foglie 113 l’una appresso de l’altra, fin che ’l ramo 114 vede a la terra tutte le sue spoglie,
115 similemente il mal seme d’Adamo 116 gittansi di quel lito ad una ad una, 117 per cenni come augel per suo richiamo.
query.result:
**English:**
112 As in autumn the leaves fall, 113 one after the other, until the branch 114 sees all its spoils upon the ground,
115 in the same way the evil seed of Adam 116 cast themselves from that shore, one by one, 117 at a signal, like birds at their call.**Cornish:**
112 Vel dell whav, pan dhrehev an delyow, 113 unn wosa unn, bys dhe'n ganghen 114 a wel an chi fow an chi foylow,
115 yn keth, an hadow drog Adam, 116 a's teffas a'n fordh na, unn wosa unn, 117 orth an chi arwodh, vel edhen orth an galow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Così sen vanno su per l’onda bruna, 119 e avanti che sien di là discese, 120 anche di qua nuova schiera s’auna.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Thus they go up on the brown wave, 119 and before they have descended on the other side, 120 another new group gathers on this side.
**Cornish:**
118 Vel dhynjynnons orth an tonn prysk, 119 ha kyns ages re beuthen diskennys, 120 bagas nowydh a onan orth an tu.

**English:**
121 "My son," said the courteous master, 122 "those who die in the wrath of God 123 all gather here from every country;
124 and they are ready to cross the river, 125 for divine justice spurs them on, 126 so that fear turns into desire.
**Cornish:**
121 "Fy mab," a leveris an mester kerensa, 122 "an re beu yn mernans Dew, 123 oll a junya ama dhyworth pub pow.
124 Ha prest yns i dhe drehedhes an avon, 125 rag an gwirvos Dew a's gorra, 126 bytteg an ofn a wra dhyworth hira."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Quinci non passa mai anima buona; 128 e però, se Caron di te si lagna, 129 ben puoi sapere omai che ’l suo dir suona».
query.result:
**English:**
127 Hence no good soul ever passes; 128 and therefore, if Charon complains about you, 129 you can now well understand what his words mean."
**Cornish:**
127 Nyns passya bythkweth anken vyth; 128 hagena, mar Charon a wraga a'th, 129 ty a yl ben poas gwybos henna ow sona y lavarow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Finito questo, la buia campagna 131 tremò sì forte, che de lo spavento 132 la mente di sudore ancor mi bagna.
query.result:
**English:**
130 When this was finished, the dark countryside 131 trembled so violently that, from the terror, 132 my mind is still drenched with sweat.
**Cornish:**
130 Pan wrug an tra, an wlas dywyll 131 a dharava glaw, marow an spuent 132 ow koweth an meyn moy gollaw.

**English:**
133 The tearful earth gave forth a wind, 134 which flashed a crimson light 135 that vanquished all my senses;
136 and I fell like a man overcome by sleep.
**Cornish:**
133 An tir whylow a roas gwyns, 134 hag un goleudh rudh a dheuth dhe ves, 135 hag a veugov pub sens owth owth,
136 Hag yth fellevi ow kov avel den.
